<a id="FogVolume"></a>

# FogVolume

**Inherits:** [VisualInstance3D](VisualInstance3D.md) **\<** [Node3D](Node3D.md) **\<** [Node](Node.md) **\<** [Object](Object.md)

A region that contributes to the default volumetric fog from the world environment.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

**FogVolume**\\ s are used to add localized fog into the global volumetric fog effect. **FogVolume**\\ s can also remove volumetric fog from specific areas if using a [FogMaterial](FogMaterial.md) with a negative [FogMaterial.density](FogMaterial.md#FogMaterial_property_density).

Performance of **FogVolume**\\ s is directly related to their relative size on the screen and the complexity of their attached [FogMaterial](FogMaterial.md). It is best to keep **FogVolume**\\ s relatively small and simple where possible.

\ **Note:** **FogVolume**\\ s only have a visible effect if [Environment.volumetric_fog_enabled](Environment.md#Environment_property_volumetric_fog_enabled) is ``true``. If you don't want fog to be globally visible (but only within **FogVolume** nodes), set [Environment.volumetric_fog_density](Environment.md#Environment_property_volumetric_fog_density) to ``0.0``.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Tutorials

- [Volumetric fog and fog volumes](../tutorials/3d/volumetric_fog.md)

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Property Descriptions

<a id="FogVolume_property_material"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Material](Material.md) **material** [ðŸ”—](#FogVolume_property_material)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_material**\ (\ value\: [Material](Material.md)\ )
- [Material](Material.md) **get_material**\ (\ )

The [Material](Material.md) used by the **FogVolume**. Can be either a built-in [FogMaterial](FogMaterial.md) or a custom [ShaderMaterial](ShaderMaterial.md).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="FogVolume_property_shape"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[FogVolumeShape](RenderingServer.md#enum_RenderingServer_FogVolumeShape) **shape** = `3` [ðŸ”—](#FogVolume_property_shape)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_shape**\ (\ value\: [FogVolumeShape](RenderingServer.md#enum_RenderingServer_FogVolumeShape)\ )
- [FogVolumeShape](RenderingServer.md#enum_RenderingServer_FogVolumeShape) **get_shape**\ (\ )

The shape of the **FogVolume**. This can be set to either [RenderingServer.FOG_VOLUME_SHAPE_ELLIPSOID](RenderingServer.md#RenderingServer_constant_FOG_VOLUME_SHAPE_ELLIPSOID), [RenderingServer.FOG_VOLUME_SHAPE_CONE](RenderingServer.md#RenderingServer_constant_FOG_VOLUME_SHAPE_CONE), [RenderingServer.FOG_VOLUME_SHAPE_CYLINDER](RenderingServer.md#RenderingServer_constant_FOG_VOLUME_SHAPE_CYLINDER), [RenderingServer.FOG_VOLUME_SHAPE_BOX](RenderingServer.md#RenderingServer_constant_FOG_VOLUME_SHAPE_BOX) or [RenderingServer.FOG_VOLUME_SHAPE_WORLD](RenderingServer.md#RenderingServer_constant_FOG_VOLUME_SHAPE_WORLD).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="FogVolume_property_size"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Vector3](Vector3.md) **size** = `Vector3(2, 2, 2)` [ðŸ”—](#FogVolume_property_size)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_size**\ (\ value\: [Vector3](Vector3.md)\ )
- [Vector3](Vector3.md) **get_size**\ (\ )

The size of the **FogVolume** when [shape](FogVolume.md#FogVolume_property_shape) is [RenderingServer.FOG_VOLUME_SHAPE_ELLIPSOID](RenderingServer.md#RenderingServer_constant_FOG_VOLUME_SHAPE_ELLIPSOID), [RenderingServer.FOG_VOLUME_SHAPE_CONE](RenderingServer.md#RenderingServer_constant_FOG_VOLUME_SHAPE_CONE), [RenderingServer.FOG_VOLUME_SHAPE_CYLINDER](RenderingServer.md#RenderingServer_constant_FOG_VOLUME_SHAPE_CYLINDER) or [RenderingServer.FOG_VOLUME_SHAPE_BOX](RenderingServer.md#RenderingServer_constant_FOG_VOLUME_SHAPE_BOX).

\ **Note:** Thin fog volumes may appear to flicker when the camera moves or rotates. This can be alleviated by increasing [ProjectSettings.rendering/environment/volumetric_fog/volume_depth](ProjectSettings.md#ProjectSettings_property_rendering/environment/volumetric_fog/volume_depth) (at a performance cost) or by decreasing [Environment.volumetric_fog_length](Environment.md#Environment_property_volumetric_fog_length) (at no performance cost, but at the cost of lower fog range). Alternatively, the **FogVolume** can be made thicker and use a lower density in the [material](FogVolume.md#FogVolume_property_material).

\ **Note:** If [shape](FogVolume.md#FogVolume_property_shape) is [RenderingServer.FOG_VOLUME_SHAPE_CONE](RenderingServer.md#RenderingServer_constant_FOG_VOLUME_SHAPE_CONE) or [RenderingServer.FOG_VOLUME_SHAPE_CYLINDER](RenderingServer.md#RenderingServer_constant_FOG_VOLUME_SHAPE_CYLINDER), the cone/cylinder will be adjusted to fit within the size. Non-uniform scaling of cone/cylinder shapes via the [size](FogVolume.md#FogVolume_property_size) property is not supported, but you can scale the **FogVolume** node instead.
